channel.title: attack.discovery on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.discovery on My New Hugo Site

item.title: DirectorySearcher Powershell Exploitation
item.description: Enumerates Active Directory to determine computers that are joined to the domain

item.title: Run Whoami as Privileged User
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed by privileged accounts that are often misused by threat actors

item.title: Redirect Output in CommandLine
item.description: Use “>” to redicrect information in commandline

item.title: Suspicious Use of PsLogList
item.description: Threat actors can use the PsLogList utility to dump event log in order to extract admin accounts and perform account discovery.

item.title: Advanced Port Scanner
item.description: Detects the use of Advanced Port Scanner.

item.title: Security Software Discovery by Powershell
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of security software, configurations, defensive tools, and sensors that are installed on a system or in a cloud environment. This may include things such as firewall rules and anti-viru

item.title: Suspicious Findstr 385201 Execution
item.description: Discovery of an installed Sysinternals Sysmon service using driver altitude (even if the name is changed).

item.title: Powershell File and Directory Discovery
item.description: Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system. Adversaries may use the information from File and Directory Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.

item.title: Suspicious Get Information for AD Groups or DoesNotRequirePreAuth User
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to find domain-level groups and permission settings. The knowledge of domain-level permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group. Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as domain administrators.

item.title: Suspicious Get Information for SMB Share
item.description: Adversaries may look for folders and drives shared on remote systems as a means of identifying sources of information to gather as a precursor for Collection and to identify potential systems of interest for Lateral Movement. Networks often contain shared network drives and folders that enable users to access file directories on various systems across a network.

item.title: Suspicious AdFind Enumerate
item.description: Detects the execution of a AdFind for enumeration

item.title: Automated Collection Bookmarks Using Get-ChildItem PowerShell
item.description: Adversaries may enumerate browser bookmarks to learn more about compromised hosts. Browser bookmarks may reveal personal information about users (ex: banking sites, interests, social media, etc.) as well as details about internal network resources such as servers, tools/dashboards, or other related infrastructure.

item.title: Suspicious DIR Execution
item.description: Use dir to collect information

item.title: Suspicious Where Execution
item.description: Adversaries may enumerate browser bookmarks to learn more about compromised hosts. Browser bookmarks may reveal personal information about users (ex: banking sites, interests, social media, etc.) as well as details about internal network resources such as servers, tools/dashboards, or other related infrastructure.

item.title: Suspicious Get Local Groups Information
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to find local system groups and permission settings. The knowledge of local system permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group. Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as the users found within the local administrators group.

item.title: Suspicious Get Local Groups Information with WMIC
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to find local system groups and permission settings. The knowledge of local system permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group. Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as the users found within the local administrators group.

item.title: Suspicious Execution of SharpView Aka PowerView
item.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

item.title: Use Get-NetTCPConnection
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of network connections to or from the compromised system they are currently accessing or from remote systems by querying for information over the network.

item.title: Use Get-NetTCPConnection
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of network connections to or from the compromised system they are currently accessing or from remote systems by querying for information over the network.

item.title: Python Initiated Connection
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts, including those that may be vulnerable to remote software exploitation

item.title: Suspicious Nmap Execution
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts, including those that may be vulnerable to remote software exploitation

item.title: WhoAmI as Parameter
item.description: Detects a suspicious process command line that uses whoami as first parameter (as e.g. used by EfsPotato)

item.title: AzureHound PowerShell Commands
item.description: Detects the execution of AzureHound in PowerShell, a tool to gather data from Azure for BloodHound

item.title: Correct Execution of Nltest.exe
item.description: The attacker might use LOLBAS nltest.exe for discovery of domain controllers, domain trusts, parent domain and the current user permissions.

item.title: Azure AD Health Monitoring Agent Registry Keys Access
item.description: This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key of Azure AD Health monitoring agent. This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Online\Reporting\MonitoringAgent.

item.title: Azure AD Health Service Agents Registry Keys Access
item.description: This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key values and sub-keys of Azure AD Health service agents (e.g AD FS). Information from AD Health service agents can be used to potentially abuse some of the features provided by those services in the cloud (e.g. Federation). This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object: HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\ADHealthAgent. Make sure you set the SACL to propagate to its sub-keys.

item.title: Powershell Suspicious Win32_PnPEntity
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to gather information about attached peripheral devices and components connected to a computer system.

item.title: Google Cloud Storage Buckets Enumeration
item.description: Detects when storage bucket is enumerated in Google Cloud.

item.title: PowerShell ADRecon Execution
item.description: Detects execution of ADRecon.ps1 for AD reconnaissance which has been reported to be actively used by FIN7

item.title: Account Enumeration on AWS
item.description: Detects enumeration of accounts configuration via api call to list different instances and services within a short period of time.

item.title: Suspicious AdFind Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of a AdFind for Active Directory enumeration

item.title: Windows Pcap Drivers
item.description: Detects Windows Pcap driver installation based on a list of associated .sys files.

item.title: Advanced IP Scanner
item.description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: Enumeration via the Global Catalog
item.description: Detects enumeration of the global catalog (that can be performed using BloodHound or others AD reconnaissance tools). Adjust Threshold according to domain width.

item.title: Harvesting of Wifi Credentials Using netsh.exe
item.description: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe

item.title: Trickbot Malware Recon Activity
item.description: Trickbot enumerates domain/network topology and executes certain commands automatically every few minutes. This detectors attempts to identify that activity based off a command rarely observed in an enterprise network.

item.title: Operation Wocao Activity
item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.title: Bloodhound and Sharphound Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

item.title: Cisco Collect Data
item.description: Collect pertinent data from the configuration files

item.title: Cisco Discovery
item.description: Find information about network devices that is not stored in config files

item.title: Cisco Sniffing
item.description: Show when a monitor or a span/rspan is setup or modified

item.title: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request
item.description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: Windows Network Enumeration
item.description: Identifies attempts to enumerate hosts in a network using the built-in Windows net.exe tool.

item.title: System Owner or User Discovery
item.description: Adversaries may use the information from System Owner/User Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.

item.title: Query Registry
item.description: Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software.

item.title: Capture a Network Trace with netsh.exe
item.description: Detects capture a network trace via netsh.exe trace functionality

item.title: SCM Database Handle Failure
item.description: Detects non-system users failing to get a handle of the SCM database.

item.title: SysKey Registry Keys Access
item.description: Detects handle requests and access operations to specific registry keys to calculate the SysKey

item.title: Hacktool Ruler
item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.title: Baby Shark Activity
item.description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware

item.title: Dridex Process Pattern
item.description: Detects typical Dridex process patterns

item.title: Net.exe Execution
item.description: Detects execution of Net.exe, whether suspicious or benign.

item.title: Renamed Whoami Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of whoami that has been renamed to a different name to avoid detection

item.title: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious command line activity on Windows systems

item.title: Whoami Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exloitation / privilege escalation but rarely used by administrators

item.title: Whoami Execution Anomaly
item.description: Detects the execution of whoami with suspicious parents or parameters

item.title: Accesschk Usage After Privilege Escalation
item.description: Accesschk is an access and privilege audit tool developed by SysInternal and often being used by attacker to verify if a privilege escalation process successful or not

item.title: AdFind Usage Detection
item.description: AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.

item.title: CrackMapExecWin
item.description: Detects CrackMapExecWin Activity as Described by NCSC

item.title: Detected Windows Software Discovery
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.

item.title: Domain User Enumeration Network Recon 01
item.description: Domain user and group enumeration via network reconnaissance. Seen in APT 29 and other common tactics and actors. Detects a set of RPC (remote procedure calls) used to enumerate a domain controller. The rule was created based off the datasets and hackathon from https://github.com/OTRF/detection-hackathon-apt29

item.title: File and Directory Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover files and directories

item.title: File and Directory Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover files and directories

item.title: GatherNetworkInfo.vbs Script Usage
item.description: Adversaries can abuse of C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs script along with cscript.exe to gather information about the target

item.title: LDAP Reconnaissance / Active Directory Enumeration
item.description: Detects possible Active Directory enumeration via LDAP

item.title: Linux Network Service Scanning
item.description: Detects enumeration of local or remote network services.

item.title: Linux Remote System Discovery
item.description: Detects the enumeration of other remote systems.

item.title: Local Groups Discovery
item.description: Detects enumeration of local system groups

item.title: Local Groups Discovery
item.description: Detects enumeration of local system groups

item.title: Local System Accounts Discovery
item.description: Detects enumeration of local systeam accounts on MacOS

item.title: Local System Accounts Discovery
item.description: Detects enumeration of local systeam accounts

item.title: MacOS Network Service Scanning
item.description: Detects enumeration of local or remote network services.

item.title: Macos Remote System Discovery
item.description: Detects the enumeration of other remote systems.

item.title: Network Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects a set of suspicious network related commands often used in recon stages

item.title: Network Scans Count By Destination IP
item.description: Detects many failed connection attempts to different ports or hosts

item.title: Network Scans Count By Destination Port
item.description: Detects many failed connection attempts to different ports or hosts

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Detects the usage of tooling to sniff network traffic. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: Password Policy Discovery
item.description: Detects password policy discovery commands

item.title: Process Discovery
item.description: Detects process discovery commands

item.title: Recon Activity with NLTEST
item.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery

item.title: Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects activity as “net user administrator /domain” and “net group domain admins /domain”

item.title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility
item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.title: Run Whoami as SYSTEM
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed by LOCAL SYSTEM. This may be a sign of a successful local privilege escalation.

item.title: Run Whoami Showing Privileges
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privieleges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.

item.title: Security Software Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities (only grep for now) to discover security software discovery

item.title: Security Software Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities (only grep for now) to discover security software discovery

item.title: Source Code Enumeration Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects source code enumeration that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Adidnsdump
item.description: This tool enables enumeration and exporting of all DNS records in the zone for recon purposes of internal networks Python 3 and python.exe must be installed, Usee to Query/modify DNS records for Active Directory integrated DNS via LDAP

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Hostname
item.description: Use of hostname to get information

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Systeminfo
item.description: Use of systeminfo to get information

item.title: Suspicious Netsh Discovery Command
item.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

item.title: Suspicious Network Command
item.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

item.title: Suspicious Query of MachineGUID
item.description: Use of reg to get MachineGuid information

item.title: Suspicious Sc Query
item.description: Adversaries may try to get information about registered services

item.title: System Information Discovery
item.description: Detects System Information Discovery commands

item.title: System Information Discovery
item.description: Detects system information discovery commands

item.title: System Network Connections Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

item.title: System Network Connections Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

item.title: System Network Discovery - Linux
item.description: Detects enumeration of local network configuration

item.title: System Network Discovery - macOS
item.description: Detects enumeration of local network configuration

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group
